name: Cackle Fever
vector: Contact with an infected creature or contaminated air in close quarters
symptoms: Random fits of uncontrollable laughter that incapacitate the infected creature
effect: After the incubation period, the infected creature gains 1 level of Exhaustion. While Exhausted, any event that causes the infected creature great stress—including entering combat, taking damage, experiencing fear, or having a nightmare—forces the creature to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5 (1d10) Psychic damage and is Incapacitated with mad laughter for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the mad laughter on a success. Any Humanoid creature that starts its turn within a 10-foot Emanation of an infected creature in the throes of mad laughter must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or also become infected with the disease.
mechanicalEffect: 1 Exhaustion level gained. Stress triggers DC 13 CON save or 1d10 Psychic damage + Incapacitated (mad laughter) for 1 minute. Contagious: DC 10 CON within 10-ft Emanation.
cure: The infected creature must succeed on three DC 13 Constitution saving throws, one at the end of each Long Rest, to recover from the disease. Each success reduces Exhaustion by 1; cured when Exhaustion drops below 1. A Greater Restoration spell or similar magic also cures the disease.
description: This disease targets humanoids, although gnomes are strangely immune. While in the grips of this disease, victims frequently succumb to fits of mad laughter, giving the disease its common name and its morbid nickname: 'the shrieks.'

name: Sewer Plague
vector: Contact with filth or offal, or being bitten by a creature that dwells amid sewage
symptoms: Fatigue, cramps, and exhaustion; the infected creature recovers poorly from rest
effect: After the incubation period, the infected creature gains one level of exhaustion, and it regains only half the normal number of hit points from spending Hit Dice and no hit points from finishing a long rest. At the end of each long rest, an infected creature must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the character gains one level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the character's exhaustion level decreases by one level. If a successful saving throw reduces the infected creature's level of exhaustion below 1, the creature recovers from the disease.
mechanicalEffect: Gains 1 exhaustion level. Regains only half HP from Hit Dice, no HP from long rest. Failed saves add exhaustion; 3 successful saves cure.
cure: Succeed on three DC 11 Constitution saving throws at the end of long rests (each success reduces exhaustion by 1; cured when exhaustion drops below 1). A lesser restoration spell or similar magic also cures the disease.
description: Sewer plague is a generic term for a broad category of illnesses that incubate in sewers, refuse heaps, and stagnant swamps, and which are sometimes transmitted by creatures that dwell in those areas, such as rats and otyughs.

name: Sight Rot
effect: Any Beast or Humanoid that drinks water tainted by Sight Rot must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the Blinded condition until the contagion ends. A Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic ends the contagion on the target.
mechanicalEffect: DC 15 CON save or Blinded until cured
cure: A Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic ends the contagion. Applying an ointment crafted with an Herbalism Kit to the eyes before finishing a Long Rest also ends the contagion (requires 3 separate applications over 3 Long Rests).
description: This painful infection causes bleeding from the eyes and immediately blinds the victim. A Beast or Humanoid that drinks water tainted by Sight Rot must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become infected.

name: Bluerot
vector: Contact with myconid spores or decaying matter in damp underground environments
symptoms: Blue-green discoloration of skin, fatigue, and hallucinations
effect: After the incubation period, the infected creature gains 1 level of Exhaustion and has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and ability checks. At the end of each Long Rest, the creature must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains another level of Exhaustion and begins experiencing vivid hallucinations. On a successful save, the creature's Exhaustion level decreases by 1. The disease ends when Exhaustion drops below 1.
mechanicalEffect: 1 Exhaustion level. Disadvantage on WIS saves and checks. Failed saves add Exhaustion. Cured when Exhaustion drops below 1.
cure: Three successful DC 12 Constitution saving throws at the end of Long Rests (each reduces Exhaustion by 1). A Lesser Restoration or Greater Restoration spell also ends the disease.
description: Named for the blue-green discoloration it causes on the skin, bluerot is commonly found in damp underground environments where myconids dwell. The spores cause the victim to hallucinate, making them suggestible and confused.

name: Filth Fever
vector: Bite from a diseased creature or contact with infected waste
symptoms: High fever, sweating, disorientation, and muscle aches
effect: After the incubation period, the infected creature has disadvantage on Strength checks, Strength saving throws, and attack rolls that use Strength. At the end of each Long Rest, the creature must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the infected creature also has disadvantage on Dexterity checks, Dexterity saving throws, and attack rolls that use Dexterity. Three successful saves in a row end the disease.
mechanicalEffect: Disadvantage on STR checks/saves/attacks. Failed saves add disadvantage on DEX checks/saves/attacks. Three consecutive successful saves cure.
cure: Three consecutive successful DC 11 Constitution saving throws at the end of Long Rests. A Lesser Restoration spell also ends the disease.
description: A raging fever sweeps through the body of the infected creature, leaving them weak and disoriented. Common among those who live or travel through swamps and sewers.

name: Flesh Rot
vector: Bite from a carrion-feeding creature or prolonged exposure to decaying flesh
symptoms: Festering sores on the skin that spread over time
effect: After the incubation period, the infected creature has disadvantage on Charisma checks and vulnerability to all damage. At the end of each Long Rest, the infected creature must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the character gains 1 level of Exhaustion. Three successful saves cure the disease.
mechanicalEffect: Disadvantage on CHA checks. Vulnerability to all damage. Failed saves add Exhaustion. Three successful saves cure.
cure: Three successful DC 13 Constitution saving throws at the end of Long Rests. A Greater Restoration spell also ends the disease.
description: The flesh of the infected creature rots and festers, spreading from the point of infection. The disease makes the victim's body extraordinarily fragile and susceptible to further harm.

name: Mindfire
vector: Psychic assault from an aberration or exposure to Far Realm energies
symptoms: Intense headaches, confusion, and difficulty concentrating
effect: The infected creature has disadvantage on Intelligence checks and Intelligence saving throws, and the creature behaves as if under the effects of the Confusion spell during combat. At the end of each Long Rest, the creature must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. Three successful saves cure the disease.
mechanicalEffect: Disadvantage on INT checks/saves. Confusion effect in combat. Three successful saves cure.
cure: Three successful DC 12 Constitution saving throws at the end of Long Rests. A Lesser Restoration spell also ends the disease.
description: This disease inflames the brain, causing delirium and confusion. Victims struggle to form coherent thoughts and may act erratically in stressful situations.

name: Seizure
vector: Contact with a diseased creature's blood or fluids
symptoms: Uncontrollable shaking and seizures during stressful situations
effect: After the incubation period, the infected creature has disadvantage on Dexterity checks, Dexterity saving throws, and attack rolls that use Dexterity. Any time the creature takes damage, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be Stunned until the end of its next turn. At the end of each Long Rest, the creature must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw; three successful saves cure the disease.
mechanicalEffect: Disadvantage on DEX checks/saves/attacks. Damage triggers DC 13 CON save or Stunned. Three successful saves cure.
cure: Three successful DC 13 Constitution saving throws at the end of Long Rests. A Greater Restoration spell also ends the disease.
description: This disease causes the victim's nervous system to fire erratically, resulting in uncontrollable shaking and seizures that can incapacitate the victim when under stress.
